question: Does GATA3 regulate cell-cycle entry and progression in bone marrow hematopoietic stem cells, such that its loss impairs HSC cycling? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Therefore, GATA-3 is required for the maintenance of a normal number of LT-HSCs and for their entry into the cell cycle.
content.source_2: Conditional deletion of Gata3 in long-term hematopoietic stem cells left cell-cycle entry and S-phase frequency unchanged at steady state and after 5-fluorouracil challenge, based on BrdU incorporation and Ki-67/DAPI profiling.
content.source_3: Furthermore, Gata3 mutant hematopoietic progenitor cells fail to be recruited into an increased cycling state after 5-fluorouracil-induced myelosuppression.
content.source_4: Bulk and single-cell analyses of adult bone marrow showed that loss of GATA-3 primarily affected lineage output while preserving the fraction of quiescent LT-HSCs, arguing against a role for GATA-3 in regulating cell-cycle progression.
